Potato___Early_blight.description: Early blight causes concentric dark brown spots on leaves and stems, leading to defoliation.
Potato___Early_blight.cause: Fungal infection caused by Alternaria solani.
Potato___Early_blight.prevention: Rotate crops, avoid overhead watering, and plant resistant varieties.
Potato___Early_blight.cure: Apply fungicides such as mancozeb or chlorothalonil.

Potato___Late_blight.description: Late blight affects leaves and tubers with water-soaked lesions that turn brown and black.
Potato___Late_blight.prevention: Use certified seed potatoes and resistant varieties; avoid humid conditions.
Potato___Late_blight.cure: Apply fungicides like mefenoxam and copper-based treatments.

Potato___healthy.description: The potato plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease or infection.
Potato___healthy.cause: No presence of pathogens or abiotic stress.
Potato___healthy.prevention: Ensure proper spacing, nutrition, and pest monitoring.
